You can create an SuperTrend indicator that does not automatically update. This lets you update the indicator with any data you choose. The following reference table describes the SuperTrend constructor.

SuperTrend()1/2

            SuperTrend QuantConnect.Indicators.SuperTrend (
     string              name,
     int                 period,
     decimal             multiplier,
     *MovingAverageType  movingAverageType,
   )

Creates a new SuperTrend indicator using the specified name, period, multiplier and moving average type.

Parameters
string name The name of this indicator.
int period The smoothing period used in average true range.
decimal multiplier The coefficient used in calculations of basic upper and lower bands.
*MovingAverageType movingAverageType (Optional) /. Default: MovingAverageType.Wilders

Return

SuperTrend - The new SuperTrend indicator object.

     decimal             multiplier,

Creates a new SuperTrend indicator using the specified period, multiplier and moving average type.

Parameters
int period The smoothing period used in average true range.
decimal multiplier The coefficient used in calculations of basic upper and lower bands.
*MovingAverageType movingAverageType (Optional) /. Default: MovingAverageType.Wilders

Return

SuperTrend - The new SuperTrend indicator object.

Definition at line 76 of file Indicators/SuperTrend.cs.


You can update the indicator automatically or manually.

Automatic Update

Create a consolidator and then call the RegisterIndicator method to update the indicator with the consolidated bars.

private SuperTrend _str;

// In Initialize()
_str = new SuperTrend(name, period, multiplier);
_str.Updated += IndicatorUpdateMethod;

var thirtyMinuteConsolidator = new TradeBarConsolidator(TimeSpan.FromMinutes(30));
var symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;
SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

RegisterIndicator(symbol, _str, thirtyMinuteConsolidator);

// In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if (_str.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _str.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.str = SuperTrend(name, period, multiplier)
self.str.Updated += self.IndicatorUpdateMethod

thirty_minute_consolidator = TradeBarConsolidator(timedelta(minutes=30))
symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol
self.SubscriptionManager.AddConsolidator(symbol, thirty_minute_consolidator)

self.RegisterIndicator(symbol, self.str, thirty_minute_consolidator)

# In IndicatorUpdateMethod()
if self.str.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.str.Current.Value

Manual Update

Updating your indicator manually enables you to control when the indicator is updated and what data you use to update it. To manually update the indicator, call the Update method that with a TradeBar. The indicator will only be ready after you prime it with enough data.

private SuperTrend _str;
private Symbol symbol;

// In Initialize()
_str = new SuperTrend(name, period, multiplier);
symbol = AddEquity("SPY").Symbol;

// In OnData()
if (data.Bars.ContainsKey(_symbol))
{
    _str.Update(data.Bars[symbol]);
}
if (_str.IsReady)
{
    var indicatorValue = _str.Current.Value;
}
# In Initialize()
self.str = SuperTrend(name, period, multiplier)
self.symbol = self.AddEquity("SPY").Symbol

# In OnData()
if data.Bars.ContainsKey(self.symbol):
    self.str.Update(data.Bars[self.symbol])
if self.str.IsReady:
    indicator_value = self.str.Current.Value
